intro: Acer villosum f. euvillosum, commonly known as the silky maple, is a deciduous tree native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its finely hairy leaves, which give it a soft, silvery appearance. The plant belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is known for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged seeds that are dispersed by the wind.
